intro: Gumira barbata, commonly known as the feathered gumira, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, barbed leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Gumira barbata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
